headline: Trump's "Reciprocal Tariffs": Why Major AI Stocks Apple, Meta, and Alphabet (Google) Are Feeling the Heat Today
summary: The whole U.S. stock market is feeling the pain from the sweeping new tariffs that President Trump announced Wednesday after the market closed.  As of 1:10 p.m. ET Thursday, the blue chip Dow Jones Industrial Average had fallen by over 1,300 points (3.1%), the broad market S&P 500 was off by 3.9%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite was down by 4.9%.  At that time, shares of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) traded more than 8% lower, Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) was down more than 6%, and shares of Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOGL) were off by more than 3%.

raw.headline: Trump's "Reciprocal Tariffs": Why Major AI Stocks Apple, Meta, and Alphabet (Google) Are Feeling the Heat Today
raw.summary: The whole U.S. stock market is feeling the pain from the sweeping new tariffs that President Trump announced Wednesday after the market closed.  As of 1:10 p.m. ET Thursday, the blue chip Dow Jones Industrial Average had fallen by over 1,300 points (3.1%), the broad market S&P 500 was off by 3.9%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite was down by 4.9%.  At that time, shares of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) traded more than 8% lower, Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) was down more than 6%, and shares of Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOGL) were off by more than 3%.

headline: Apple's Cook kissed Trump's ring, but tariffs wipe out nearly $300B in value

headline: Will Trump tariffs make Apple iPhones more expensive?
summary: Your favorite iPhone could soon become pricier, thanks to tariffs.  U.S. President Donald Trump imposed a series of sweeping tariffs on countries around the world that could drastically alter the landscape of global trade, and consumer goods like iPhones could be among the hardest hit, analysts said on Thursday.  Most iPhones are still made in China, which was hit with a 54% tariff.

Most iPhones are still made in China, which was hit with a 54% tariff.

headline: Tariffs Leave Apple With Nothing But Hard Choices—Heard on the Street
summary: Apple’s costs are about to go way up thanks to tariffs.  The biggest question facing the world’s most valuable company now is whether to make customers pay for it—or investors.  Apple was the worst hit among megacap tech stocks in the tariff-sparked selloff, given that it is the only one in the group that depends on hardware not made in the U.S. for the majority of its revenue.

raw.headline: Tariffs Leave Apple With Nothing But Hard Choices—Heard on the Street
raw.summary: Apple’s costs are about to go way up thanks to tariffs.  The biggest question facing the world’s most valuable company now is whether to make customers pay for it—or investors.  Apple was the worst hit among megacap tech stocks in the tariff-sparked selloff, given that it is the only one in the group that depends on hardware not made in the U.S. for the majority of its revenue.

headline: Watch These Apple Price Levels as Stock Slides After Trump Tariff Announcement
summary: Apple shares fell sharply in extended trading Wednesday after President Trump unveiled sweeping reciprocal tariffs, including a steep 34% import tax on China, the country where the iPhone maker manufactures about 90% of its products. Monitor these major chart levels.
